results.title: Cloud over Ohio
results.creator_credit: Edward Plumb, Karl Maslowski and S O H I O
results.brief_description: In spite of a high annual rainfall, the state of Ohio, USA has faced severe droughts. This film illustrates the part played by water in the daily lives of the inhabitants, also its use in industry and agriculture, then probes for reasons behind the apparent wastage of water resources. Draws particular attention to wastage of both soil and water resulting from soil erosion. Includes close-up shots of rain drops striking unprotected soil, showing the extent and nature of the damage caused.

results.title: Clothing
results.creator_credit: John Barnes, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Primitive peoples used the materials available in their immediate environment from which to make clothing for themselves. This film traces the development of the textile arts through hand-processes of various nationalities to modern mass-production methods of an industrialised economy. The effect of climate and environment on the materials and modes of dress, and the effects of modern mass-production, coupled with the development of transport and communication methods, are studied. The clothing from industrialised countries is shown to be becoming increasingly widespread throughout the world.

results.title: Cloth: fiber to fabric
results.creator_credit: William Kay and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Cotton, wool and silk are natural fibres, although grown in different ways; synthetic fibres such as rayon and nylon are created by chemical processes. However, all can be woven into cloth on power looms or knitting machines, and the fabric produced can be used for flameproof firemens’ suits, seat belts and parachutes as well as common articles like clothing, rugs, towels.

results.title: Closing behaviour (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Phil Content, Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera and University of Southern California
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Interaction in the Multicultural Classroom”.
An introduction to various sorts of closing behaviour often used by the classroom teacher - shifting attention from one child to another, not listening fully to the child’s response - the film points out that too much closing behaviour prevents children developing.

results.title: Closed chest and cardiac massage
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Emergency Resuscitation”.
The techniques of closed chest cardiac massage is demonstrated by instructor, and by means of animated diagrams. The need for correct technique is stressed, when the method is used, accompanied by exhaled air resuscitation in cases of cardiac arrest and respiratory failure. The hazards of careless of misdirected application are explained.

results.title: Close your eyes and hold your stomach
results.brief_description: In a survey of some of the ways Australian children are discovering their own kind of theatre, this film focuses on a touring children’s theatre company, the Pageant Theatre in Education, which tours Australian schools. School children are invited by the actors to participate in the production of each play and their responses influence the shape of the play. Children of different age groups are observed creating fantasy worlds on the one hand and recreating political and social issues on the other. Made with the assistance of the Australian Film & Television School. Narrated by Robert Bruning.

results.title: Close-up on Kuwait
results.creator_credit: Rodney Giesler, Derek Armstrong and Kuwait Oil Company Film Unit
results.brief_description: From Kuwait more oil is shipped annually than from any other oil port in the world, bringing in return a wealth of manufactured goods from other countries. A Government Development Board ensures that the country as a whole shares this new prosperity in the free State medical service, schools, and research into cultivation of desert areas.

results.title: Clockwork lemon
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubetzki, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. Shows the effects of technological change on the worker in the printing industry. Do computers take away the enjoyment of the job? Have a lot of skills been lost? Is job security at risk?

results.title: Climbing plants
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Botany”.
The film provides a clear explanation of every plant’s need for light and then shows the adaptations which are developed by climbing plants to fulfil this need. Time-lapse techniques are used to illustrate the twining of stems and the growth of different kinds of tendrils. Designed for class-room use.

results.title: Climb
results.creator_credit: Dewitt Jones, Churchill Films and Film Technology Company
results.brief_description: This is both a realistic adventure of rock-climbing and a metaphorical ascent in which limits are tested and personal values are explored. As the two climbers express their thoughts in the narration, we watch their breathtaking progress up a sheer rock face in Yosemite Valley. We learn a few rudiments of rock-climbing and about the climbers feelings and motivations.
